I have seen people skating around this issue but nobody seems to be
answeri=
ng the question or maybe I just missed it - I did search the
archives and I=
 see the question but no answer.

I followed the details in the "JUnit 4.0 =
in 10 minutes" article. I
wrote a test class. I am using a suite such as

 =
   public static junit.framework.Test suite() {
        return new JUnit4Te=
stAdapter(TestSynonymEngine.class);
    }

I am running my tests from an An=
t 1.6.2. In my ant script I have a
target with a <junit> task that ultimate=
ly uses a <batchtest> to run
my tests. The tests run and pass or fail appro=
priately, but, where I
should have the name of the tests that were run I in=
stead get

    [junit] Testcase: unknown took 2.109 sec                    =
     
                                                  
    [junit] Testca=
se: unknown took 0.156 sec                         
                       =
                           
    [junit] Testcase: unknown took 0.11 sec    =
                      
                                                  
 =
   [junit] Testcase: unknown took 0.204 sec                         
      =
                                            
    [junit] Testcase: unknown =
took 0.093 sec                         
                                   =
               

and my <junitreport> output similarly shows the names of t=
he tests as
"unknown".

It was my understanding that the whole purpose of t=
he
JUnit4TestAdapter was "so that the new JUnit 4 tests can be run with
the=
 old runners". So am I seeing a bug in JUnit4TestAdapter or what?
Did I mis=
s some configuration option or documentation detail or FAQ?
If so, please p=
oint me in the right direction.

I would like to move to JUnit4 as I really=
 like the enhancements but
not knowing the name of the failing test is a de=
al breaker and I don't
have any interest in using alpha-Ant code on my prod=
uction builds. The
output of <junitreport> is critical for our build proces=
s, so...

Kevin
